author: ralexstokes
content: anyone thought about using sha256 instead of keccak for the tx hash computation in 4844?

author: ralexstokes
content: (the context here is the development arc where we decide to "SSZ-ify" everything and as written 4844 assumes this future w/ the transaction structure; in this world view, we want to reduce usage of keccak256 in favor of sha256)

author: bridge-bot
content: <protolambda> I think sha256 for tx-hashes introduces more techdebt than good, due to the way the tx-type is not part of the hash *output (like versioned hashes), and so to verify a transaction preimage you would then have to try different hash functions to verify contents behind a hash.
